title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: A chemical reaction's spontaneity is influenced by factors like enthalpy (ΔH) and entropy (ΔS). The Gibbs free energy (ΔG) equation, $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$, helps determine reaction spontaneity. If $$\Delta G<0$$, the reaction is spontaneous.

title: Interpreting Entropy Change
text: The problem states $$\Delta S<0$$, meaning entropy decreases. Combine this with the principle that a reaction is spontaneous when the Gibbs free energy (ΔG) is negative.

title: The Role of Enthalpy
text: To achieve $$\Delta G<0$$ with a negative ΔS, a large negative ΔH is needed. This could overpower the entropy term TΔS, making ΔG negative.

title: Considering Temperature
text: If T is low, the effect of TΔS on ΔG becomes smaller. Thus, at low temperatures, even if ΔS is negative, a suitable ΔH can make ΔG negative, leading to spontaneity.

hintAnswer: $$\Delta H<0$$ and T is very low
title: Selecting the Correct Conditions
text: Given that $$\Delta S<0$$, what should be the conditions of ΔH and T for ΔG to remain negative? Use the hints and your understanding to find the right answer.
choices: $$\Delta H<0$$ and T is very high
$$\Delta H>0$$ and T is very high
$$\Delta H>0$$ and T is very low
$$\Delta H<0$$ and T is very low
